query: If C is put into F, where will C be located? If E is added to F with D and stirred with A, what happens next?

original_scene.description: A is a stirring stick. B is a bottle of red dye. C is an egg. D is a spoon. E is a cup of salt. F is a cup of water.

key_step_1.conclusion: Add B to F, and then put C into F. Since the density of C is greater than that of F, C sinks to the bottom of F.

key_step_2.conclusion: Use D to continuously add E to F and stir with A. D dissolves in F, causing the density of F to gradually increase until it becomes the same as the density of C. At this time, C floats in F.

key_step_3.conclusion: Continue to use D to add E to F. When the density of F is greater than the density of C, C begins to float out of F.

subject: mechanics
